meanings.definition: A style of dance popular in the 1960s.
meanings.sent1: At the party, everyone joined in the boogy.
meanings.sent2: The DJ played a catchy boogy that got everyone on the dance floor.
meanings.sent3: The boogy at the school talent show was full of fun twists and turns.
meanings.sent4: The boogy of the disco era still echoes in modern dance moves.
meanings.sent5: Her boogy was so infectious, it spread to the whole crowd.

meanings.definition: A piece of music that inspires dancing.
meanings.sent1: The upbeat boogy had everyone tapping their feet.
meanings.sent2: The classic rock band played a boogy that had the audience on their feet.
meanings.sent3: The catchy boogy played on the radio made her want to dance.
meanings.sent4: The lively boogy filled the room with energy and joy.
meanings.sent5: His favorite boogy always put him in a good mood.

meanings.sent1: She loved to boogy to her favorite songs.
meanings.sent2: The kids started to boogy as soon as the music began.
meanings.sent3: They decided to boogy all night long at the dance party.
meanings.sent4: The friends boogied together in perfect harmony.
meanings.sent5: He couldn't help but boogy when the beat dropped.

meanings.definition: A ghost or spirit, especially one that causes mischief.
meanings.sent1: The old house was said to be haunted by a mischievous boogy.
meanings.sent2: Children love to tell stories about the friendly boogy in the attic.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous boogy was blamed for the disappearing cookies.
meanings.sent4: The legend of the boogy in the forest scared the campers.
meanings.sent5: She pretended to be a boogy to play a prank on her friends.
